definition: to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Sister long unrestrained, can not find the direction of modesty.
sentences.chinese: 姊長期奔放，找不到矜持的方向。

sentences.english: Spanish dancing is very passionate and untrammeled. I really like it.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的舞蹈熱情奔放，我很喜歡。

sentences.english: Haihe River, breeds up the cradle of Tianjin.
sentences.chinese: 海河，孕育了天津這座城市奔放且坦蕩的本性。

sentences.english: The scene bubbling with enthusiasm in those years, we could not forget it for many years.
sentences.chinese: 當年那種熱情奔放的情景，我們多年都未能忘懷。

sentences.english: His natural ebullience began to return.
sentences.chinese: 他開始恢復與生俱來的熱情奔放。

sentences.english: Bright apricot yellow would have created a mood of unrestrained youth.
sentences.chinese: 明快的杏黃色又會創造出青春的奔放意境。

sentences.english: She was in severe winter and spring in March.
sentences.chinese: 她在寒冬臘月奔放，又在陽春三月凋落。

sentences.english: Jazz - Rock n roll style character.
So I let my emotions run their course, and then respond when I’m calmer.
sentences.chinese: 因此我讓自己的情緒奔放，然後在平靜下來後再回復。

sentences.english: The ebullience of youth shines through me.
sentences.chinese: 青年時期奔放通過我發光。

sentences.english: I returned home, I believe, with some reason for an access of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 在我離開那回家時，我相信我有理由熱情奔放。

sentences.english: Because we remember youth dreams, untrammelled enthusiasm and understanding of love.
sentences.chinese: 青春夢想，熱情奔放，愛情詮釋。

sentences.english: Red glow is bold and unrestrained, festival auspicious sign , this is revolutionary spirit.
sentences.chinese: 紅色熱情奔放，喜慶祥瑞，這是紅色的精神。

sentences.english: The last time I saw him he was bubbling over with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我上次見到他時他熱情奔放。

sentences.english: She exuded joie de vivre and an ebullient sensuality that she lost.
sentences.chinese: 她散發出的對生活之樂和熱情奔放的感覺都消失了。

sentences.english: Passion will be your war-horse, this year.
sentences.chinese: 這一年，將會是水瓶座熱情奔放的一年。

definition: to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
